dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: I still think this is a bad idea, but the family is assembled.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: (to Blanc) I know where the tox report is.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marta jimmies the clock drawer open with a letter opener. She pulls a FOLDED PIECE OF PAPER from inside, blows loos pot leaves off it. She hands it to Blanc.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: She practically told me where it was. Anyway this'll tie everything up. And I just handed it to you, god you're you're not much of a detective are you?

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: To be fair you're a pretty lousy murderer. Perhaps we deserve each other.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The family gathered, impatient. Lieutenant Elliott and Trooper Wagner are there too, with another uniformed officer. Ransom sits in the corner, his face passive. Marta gulps. Blanc is a few steps behind her. As she speaks, he unfolds and reads the tox report.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Um. You guys have always been good to me. And what I'm about to say isn't going to be easy, and you're going to be upset, but especially after everything you've gone through the past few days, I thought you deserved to hear it from me.  103. Walt smiles at her, “you're doing the right thing." Marta takes a deep breath. Blanc has finished reading the report. He refolds it carefully. MARTA (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Excuse me. You have not been good to her. You have all treated her like shit to steal back a fortune that you lost and she deserves. You're a pack of bloody vultures at the feast, but you're not getting bailed out, not this time. (beat) Ms. Cabrera has decided definitively not to renounce the inheritance.

dialogues.speaker: WALT
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Furthermore it will be my professional recommendation to the local authorities that the manner of death in the case of Harlan Thrombey is ruled as suicide, and the case is closed.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: MARTA BLANC
dialogues.text: What? No, Blanc - Thank you all for coming goodbye. He firmly guides Marta out by the elbow. A beat of silenc

dialogues.speaker: RICHARD
dialogues.text: Is anybody else confused? As the family breaks out in hubub, Linda notices her dad' OLD BASEBALL on the side table where Blanc left it. What' that doing here? She picks it up.  104.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blanc steers Marta into the library, as sounds of hubub a shouting come from the other room.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: What the hell? I want to come clean, this is over -

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Almost. Elliott bursts in, motions to the living room, then Marta then Blanc.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT ELLIOTT
dialogues.text: What - with - what?

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: I'm sorry - officer Wagner! Wagner enters. BLANC (cont'd) Please keep the family out of this room and get them out of the house if you can. But stand by with your additional officer.

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER WAGNER
dialogues.text: Get the family out?

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Yes but not all of them. Blanc whispers something to Wagner, who nods and exits.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT ELLIOTT
dialogues.text: Blanc c'mon, what's all this Drama.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Indulge me. Marta sits. Elliott remains standing.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Blanc. I told Ransom, Ransom told you, I'm telling you now - it is an immovable fact that I killed Harlan.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Yes you did, yes he did, yes you are, but. But. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLANC (cont'd) I spoke in the car about the hole at the center of this donut. And yes, what you and Harlan did that fateful night seems at first glance to fill that hole perfectly. A donut hole in the donut's hole. But we must look a little closer. And when we do, we see that the donut hole has a hole in its center - it is not a donut hole at all but a smaller donut with its own hole, and our donut is not whole at all!

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT ELLIOTT
dialogues.text: Blanc I understand that this is amusing for you -

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Why. Was. I. Hired? Why would someone hire me?

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT ELLIOTT
dialogues.text: Someone fishing for any crime that could help reverse the will.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: I was hired before the sealed will was read. Yes, the person must have known the contents of the will. But one step further - that same person must have known a crime was committed, and further, if the intent was to reverse Marta's inheritance, they must have known that Marta was responsible. (beat) An intriguing combination of factors. Someone who knew what Marta did, wanted to expose it, but could not reveal how they knew.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Fran? She was blackmailing me, she knew what I did

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: But Fran wanted money, ergo she did not want the crime exposed.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT ELLIOTT
dialogues.text: Did someone in the family see Marta doing something suspicious?  106.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: They would have had no reason to not speak up. No. The answer is not so simple. Blanc sits, suddenly weary. BLANC (cont'd) Now with the entire solution in my field of view, the arc of this case is a tragedy of errors. And Marta, it will not be easy to hear. But there is at least one truly guilty party behind it all, guilty in the true sense of acting with malice, and committing a heinous crime with selfish intent. (calls) Trooper Wagner.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: (stunned) Trooper Wagner?? Blanc squints at her. No. A moment later Wagner leads Ransom in. Ransom looks at Marta softly, sadly.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: Marta I'm sorry. I told them everything, I figured it was all up. I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: It's alright Ransom, I'm glad you did.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Not exactly everything though.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Is this about what Greatnana told you? She saw me that night, she mistook me for Ransom

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: We'll get to that. But first, Mr. Hugh Ransom Drysdale, you might tell us all why you hired me.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: Why I hired you?  107.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: You're right, let's back up. To the night of the party. Your argument with Harlan. What were the overheard words by the Nazi child masturbating in the bathroom - "my will" and "I'm warning you." You and Harlan were “drama mamas," you shared a love of twisting the knife into one another. I don't believe he would have slipped it in halfway - no, I submit that Harlan told you everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ransom and Harlan face each other.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: You can't be serious.

dialogues.speaker: HARLAN
dialogues.text: Not a red dime or word of my work to a single one of them, you included.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Marta, remind me what Ransom said his conversation with Harlan ended with.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Harlan told him that I could beat him in GO.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: And I asked myself - Marta? Why would the topic of the will have steered around to Marta? There is one obvious explanation...

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: You are not this crazy. You would not just throw your fortune away

dialogues.speaker: HARLAN
dialogues.text: No. I'm giving it to Marta. All of it.  108.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: Ha. To your Brazilian nurse are you goddamn insane.

dialogues.speaker: HARLAN RANSOM
dialogues.text: I'm sane for the first time I'm going to stop this in my life and I've done it Harlan, I - I've made the change to my will it's done RANSOM (cont'd) I'm warning you! Push into a vent in the wall.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: That is some heavy duty conjecture.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Granted. But it's the only way what comes next makes sense. So you storm out, you drive off into the night. You tell Marta later of what was it, feeling an overwhelming sense of...

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Clarity. That he has to make do for himself from here on out.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Exactly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ransom's Porsche SKIDS TO A STOP on the side of the empty road. Sits idling.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Marta. The will. Harlan. "You won't get away with this." Do for yourself. And a plan forms. A beat. Then the Porsche roars into a skidding U-TURN and drives back the way it came.  109.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ransom's Porsche kills its lights and drives slowly down private road, hooking a left at the CARVED ELEPHANT that marks the utility road.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You return, careful to avoid the gate's security camera range.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Porsche parked, Ransom hacks his way through the wood

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Then on foot up towards the house,

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The party is still going on inside. Ransom slips through the side gate, up towards the house, and up the trellis.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You sneak in, up the trellis so as not to be seen by the rest of the family, who are still having their party downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The painting wall swings aside, and Ransom climbs through leaving mud traces on the sill and the carpet. He heads straight down the narrow hall and into Harlan's bedroom. The party din from downstairs.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What you need to do will take moments. But it is essential you are alone, and undetected. Ransom disappears into the darkened doorway. BLANC (V.O.) (cont'd) You knew the medications Harlan took. You knew what Marta would be injecting him with that night. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLANC (V.O.) (cont'd) And you knew if Marta was responsible for his death, even unintentionally, the slayer rule would nullify the changed will, and you would get your share back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dark and still. Marta's medical bag, open. Ransom has unwrapped two syringes and has the two vials out - the Toradol and the morphine (the "good stuff.") Using the syringes he extracts the liquid from both vials and then injects the liquids back into the opposite vials He SWITCHES THE MEDICATIONS.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You use the syringes in the kit to switch the liquids in the two medication vials. And as a final precaution, you take the Naloxone, the life saving antidote. Replacing the vials he takes an injection pen, closes the bag up and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marta is stunned, she can't even process this.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: No, no that's impossible.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: It is the truth. Hand me that vial of morphine, I'll show you. Blanc has placed two identical vials on the table behind Marta. Her mind is still spinning, she glances at them, takes one and absently hands it to him.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: If he did that, if the meds were switched, then when I got them mixed up... (oh my god) I accidentally switched them back. But then I gave Harlan  111.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: The correct doses. Yes. But not accidentally. I taped over the labels of these two vials. Blanc shows white tape over the one she just handed him. Picks up the other vial, shows the same. BLANC (cont'd) The vials themselves are identical. How did you know that this was the morphine?

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: I... just knew

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: You knew because there is the slightest, almost imperceptible difference of tincture and viscosity between the liquids. You knew because you had done it a hundred times. You gave him the correct medication. Because you are a good nurse.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Then Harlan was...

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: I'm sorry Marta. But yes. Harlan was perfectly fine. He unfolds the tox report and hands it to her. BLANC (cont'd) His blood was normal. The cause of death was truly, solely suicide, and you are guilty of nothing but some damage to the trellis and a few amateur theatrics. In fact if he had listened to you, he would be alive today. Marta is white as a ghost. She shudders, buckles over.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT ELLIOTT
dialogues.text: Hot damn.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: A twisted web, and we are not finished untangling it. Not yet. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLANC (cont'd) Marta when Greatnana spotted you climbing down the trellis she said

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marta facing Greatnana, who says:

dialogues.speaker: GREATNANA
dialogues.text: Ransom? Are you back again already?

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Are you back again already, because earlier that night - CUT TO: the exact same scene but RANSOM hops down off the trellis, and is startled by Greatnana staring at him.

dialogues.speaker: GREATNANA
dialogues.text: Ransom, you're back! He puts his finger to his lips - shhh, and blows a kiss a he walks off into the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marta with her fingers on her temples, still unbelieving.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: Marta c'mon. (to Blanc) This is stoopid with two o's and you don't have a shred of evidence, you're just spinning a fairy tale.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Not a shred no, just as we have no real proof of Marta's mixing up the vials so it's your word against -

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: You have her confession! The sharpness of this makes Marta look at Ransom for the first time.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Ah right, we do have that. If you'll indulge me, I'd like to spin a little further.  113.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Moonlit, silent.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Much later that night you would have to come back to the house, to break back in and retrieve the incriminating tampered vials. A dark figure, Ransom, approaches the side gate. But when he opens it, the two dogs come bounding across the lawn, barking loudly. BLANC (V.O.) (cont'd) However, this time the dogs were outside. They barked. Waking Meg. A light goes on upstairs. The dogs keep barking, paws on the gate. Ransom backs off. BLANC (V.O.) (cont'd) No matter. You'll get the vials tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: But tomorrow brings news not of a medical error and guilty nurse, but of a slit throat and suicide!?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A nervous Ransom tears a clipping from the local newspape about Harlan's death, stuffs in it an envelope with a hug fold of cash, and addresses it to Blanc. The New Yorker profile open on the couch.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now the circumstances are perfect for the anonymous hiring of a me: you know a crime has been committed by Marta, you need her to be caught for it, you cannot reveal how you know.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Enter Benoit Blanc.  114. Elliott can't help but roll his eyes.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT ELLIOTT
dialogues.text: Benny look I hear what you are saying Trooper Wagner quickly shushs Elliott, enthralled by ever word Blanc says.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: The body was discovered early the next morning. The police, the medical examiners, the family, everyone swarms in, (to Ransom) and there is no possible way you can get to Marta's medical bag to remove the vials. You must wait for your moment, when the investigation is over and you know the house will be empty. And that is why you missed the funeral.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ransom bounds up the stairs, climbs under the POLICE TAPE blocking Harlan's study, and enters.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: there is no one home to wonder why you're going into Harlan's study. Or so you think. Fran comes around the corner, spots Ransom and is about t say something, but doesn't. BLANC (V.O.) (cont'd) Poor Fran. She witnessed you tampering with Harlan's medication in the medical bag. She did not know what you were doing. But she knew you were up to no good. And so her mind begins to turn. Ransom pockets the two incriminating vials from the medic bag and replaces the Naloxone pen. When he stands to go s retreats.  115.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Oh god that movie she told me about, with Danica McKellar, that's what she was talking about -

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER WAGNER
dialogues.text: Deadly by Surprise.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: She loved Harlan. She hates Ransom. So the poor girl decides to test her theory and make this asshole pay. She gets a copy of the toxicology report, I will be honest I have no idea how

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: She has a cousin - she told me, she has a cousin who works as a receptionist at the examiners office!

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Well voila. The numbers mean nothing to her, but if Ransom is guilty its existence is a threat, so she photocopies the header and makes her blackmail note.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: So why did she send it to me?

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: She did not. She sent it to Ransom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ransom walks in sorting mail - finds the blank envelope, reads the blackmail note inside, and slowly grins.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And when Ransom first gets it, what is his reaction? Elation! He still thinks Marta gave Harlan the tampered drugs! A blood tox report will prove Marta's guilt!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The will reading, the family assembled. Ransom sits in back, a sly smile on his face as the will is read.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: He goes to the will reading in high spirits, ready to see the family tear themselves apart, secure in the knowledge that it will all be undone when the tox report comes to light. And then...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beers stacked up. Marta has just confessed. Ransom's face is unreadable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blanc rounds

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Marta's confession. And everything turns on its head. Now he realizes that Marta has committed no crime, and the tox report will prove her innocence. The changed will is going to stand. He has lost. Unless. on Ransom.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Unless you decide.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ransom giving Marta his pep talk -

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: ...you're not going to give up the money.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: You are not going to give up the money.  117.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: You've come this far!

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: You have come this far. Just one step further. Just one last act, in for a penny, in for a pound. You decide. You are in. CLOSE ON: A lighter ignites a rag stuffed in a tin gas ca THE CAN: Being thrown through a window in a brick wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Empty, dark. The flaming can falls in slow motion from th high window. Hits the floor, ignites.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Step one: destroy all evidence of Marta's innocence. The flames dance in the reflection of a glass case of refrigerated BLOOD SAMPLES. BLANC (V.O.) (cont'd) Step two:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON: The BLACKMAIL NOTE - at the bottom is written "1209 COLUMBUS ROAD 8AM" A hand TEARS this bottom part of then puts the top half in an envelope.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Send Marta the anonymous email with a late morning rendezvous time, CLOSE ON: An email addressed to Marta being typed on a phone, "1209 COLUMBUS ROAD 10AM"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ransom creeps down the hall, slips the ENVELOPE into the letter slot of Marta's door.  118.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: and deliver her the blackmail note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ransom's Porsche pulls up. He gets out, pulling on gloves

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Step three: keep your appointment with Fran.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fran standing in the middle of the room, nervous. She tur as Ransom walks in and strides towards her.

dialogues.speaker: FRAN
dialogues.text: I knew it. I knew you were a no good son of a bitch, I knew Harlan wouldn't have just killed himself.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: Yes, you were right Fran. Ransom sees the medical bag on the floor, kneels and pull something out of it.

dialogues.speaker: FRAN
dialogues.text: I knew you were guilty as shit. Now you're gonna pay for it don't come near me I'm warning you I - But he's upon her, hand over her mouth, stifling her scre as he pushes the syringe into her neck and PUSHES THE PLUNGER. MINUTES LATER - her inert body in the chair. He fishes through her pockets, finds the envelope, and takes the TO REPORT from it, leaves the empty envelope in her hands. On his way out: lights the tox report on fire, drops it burning next to Marta's bag. We stay with it as it burns away.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Now the board is set. Marta will get the blackmail note. You will put the pieces together for her - the tox report, her one chance at getting away with it all. You'll guide her to the rendezvous. (MORE )

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: BLANC (V.O.) (cont'd) You'll make an anonymous call to the police, they will catch her there with the body and the burned evidence. Marta will be arrested for killing Fran... and Harlan.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: She said -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marta holding Fran on the floor, her dying words -

dialogues.speaker: FRAN
dialogues.text: you... did this...

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: She didn't say "you did this," she wasn't talking about me, she said

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exact same moment but this time we hear -

dialogues.speaker: FRAN
dialogues.text: Hugh... did this...

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Hugh did this. Cause you made the help call you Hugh. Cause you're an asshole.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: (to Ransom) It would have worked. If we hadn't brought you in for questioning, so you could not make your anonymous call. And if Fran had not stashed a safety copy of the tox report.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Marta turns away from the dying Fran.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: And if Marta had not outplayed you once again. 120. Marta turns back, calls 911, gives mouth to mouth to Fran BLANC (V.O.) (cont'd) By having a kind heart. By saving Fran's life, though it meant her losing the inheritance and going to jail. She didn't play your game, she saved Fran's life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the first time, Ransom looks afraid.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: Fran's alive? Marta's phone starts to ring. They all see the caller id it's the hospital.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: (to Marta) Oh yes. Fran, who will confirm this fairy story or something close to it. (to Ransom) And will send you, Hugh, to jail. She answers the call, puts the phone to her ear.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: Yes. A long beat, then her face breaks in relief. MARTA (cont'd) Yes. Thank you doctor, that's great news, we'll be there soon. She hangs up. And smiles with radiant joy. MARTA (cont'd) She's okay. (to Blanc) She's ready to talk.  121. Ransom stares at Marta, his face a mask.

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Trooper Wagner, if you would keep Mr. Drysdale in custody while Lieutenant Elliott, Ms. Cabrera and myself go to the hospital to take Fran's statement. Ransom stands. Steps to Marta, who's frozen, looking in h eyes. His poker face breaks. And he grins.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: I want to say this just to you, not to a courtroom of cameras, just to you because you know it's the truth: we allowed you into our home. We allowed you to take care of granddad, to be part of our family and now you think you can steal it from us? You think I'm not going to fight for our birthright, our home, our ancestral family home?

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: Harlan bought this house in the eighties. From a Pakistani real estate baron.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: Oh shut up Blanc, shut up! Shut up with that Kentucky fried fog horn rag-horn drawl. Yeah I killed Fran but I guess I didn't, so what do you have on me. Nothing What? attempted murder - (to Blanc) I get arson for the bombing, maybe a few other charges, with a good lawyer I'll be out before you know it. Face to face, Ransom's face hateful, Marta's strong and s RANSOM (cont'd) (to Marta) And then you'll see just how much hell I can wreak on your life, you vicious little bitch. But then... Marta's face starts to do things. Odd things. Convulses. Her jaw clenches. Her cheeks bulge. And the PROJECTILE VOMITS into Ransom's face.  122. RANSOM (cont'd)

dialogues.speaker: AUGH
dialogues.text: He falls back cursing, she drops to her knees, spitting. Wagner, inappropriately excited:

dialogues.speaker: TROOPER WAGNER
dialogues.text: That means she was lying!

dialogues.speaker: MARTA
dialogues.text: That's right, Fran's dead. (to Ransom) And you just confessed to her murder. Ransom takes this in. Then he smirks.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: Well. In for a penny... In one fluid motion he spins to the ornamental WALL OF KNIVES, grabs one -

dialogues.speaker: BLANC
dialogues.text: No! and TACKLES MARTA... Time slows as Blanc and Elliott lunge to stop him but it' too late - Ransom and Marta fall together, his arm arcing down And as the they hit the ground his arm comes down PLUNGING THE KNIFE UP TO THE HILT IN HER CHEST. They lie still, breathing hard. Her eyes wide with pain a horror. His cold and wild. But then she blinks. Squints. And he cocks his head. Realizing something. Withdraws the knife from her chest. Its fake blade had retracted into the handle. It's a theatrical prop. He pumps it up and down a few times, the spring making a pathetic toy noise. Ransom smirks.  123.

dialogues.speaker: RANSOM
dialogues.text: Shit And is VIOLENTLY TACKLED out of frame by Trooper Wagner. Leaving Marta lying on her back. Blanc shouting if she's alright, Elliott and Wagner wrestling Ransom into cuffs, all fades into the background as she holds the knife and stares at the ceiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown

dialogues.text: Oh my god.

dialogues.text: I want you to remember something very important: you won not by playing the game Harlan's way, but yours. Through the window she sees the family outside.

dialogues.speaker: MARTA

dialogues.text: I have my own opinion. But I have a feeling you'll follow your heart. He gives her a wink, and strolls off.

dialogues.text: Marta shuffles to the front doorway. One last glance at Harlan's portrait, its grin now gentle and content.
